revision.text:
{{Infobox military person | native_name = Иван Сергеевич Горбачёв | image = Ivan Sergevich Gorbachyov.jpg | birth_date = 29 October 1902 | death_date = {{deathdateandage|1941|7|25|1902|10|29|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Strechanovo]], [[Roslavlsky Uyezd]], [[Smolensk Governorate]], [[Russian Empire]] | death_place = [[Demyakhi]], [[Belsky District]], [[Smolensk Oblast]], [[Soviet Union]] | allegiance = Soviet Union | branch = [[NKVD]] [[Border Troops]] [[Red Army]] | serviceyears = 1924{{endash}}1941 | rank = [[Major general]] | commands = [[250th Rifle Division (Soviet Union)|250th Rifle Division]] | battles = [[World War II]] *[[Battle of Smolensk (1941)]] | awards = [[Order of the Red Star]] }}
'''Ivan Sergeyevich Gorbachyov''' ({{Lang-ru|Иван Сергеевич Горбачёв}}; 29 October 1902{{En dash}}25 July 1941) was a [[Red Army]] [[Major general]]. Gorbachyov led the [[250th Rifle Division (Soviet Union)|250th Rifle Division]] during the [[Battle of Smolensk (1941)|Battle of Smolensk]] and died of wounds.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.generals.dk/general/Gorbachev/Ivan_Sergevich/Soviet_Union.html|title=Biography of Major-General Ivan Sergevich Gorbachev – (Иван Сергеевич Горбачев) (1902–1941), Soviet Union|website=www.generals.dk|access-date=2016-08-01}}</ref>{{Sfn|Maslov|1998|pp=13{{endash}}14}}
== Early life == Gorbachyov was born in [[Strechanovo]], to a peasant family. He worked as a farm labourer.{{Sfn|Maslov|1998|pp=13{{endash}}14}} His family moved and Gorbachyov graduated from a gymnasium school in [[Kamensk-Shakhtinsky|Kamensk]].<ref name=":0" /> He joined the [[Communist Party of the Soviet Union]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://pamyat-naroda.ru/commander/290/|title=Горбачев, Иван, Сергеевич|last=|first=|date=|website=pamyat-naroda.ru|publisher=|language=Russian|trans-title=Gorbachyov, Ivan Sergeyevich|access-date=2016-08-01}}</ref>
== Interwar == Gorbachyov joined the Red Army in January 1924. In 1926, he graduated from the [[Ivanovo|Ivanovo-Voznesensk]] Infantry School. From 1926 to 1934, Gorbachyov served with the [[Batumi]] and [[Nakhichevansk]] border detachments as a border outpost assistant chief, chief of a border outpost, and commander of a border sector. In June 1934, Gorbachyov became a student at the [[Frunze Military Academy]], from which he graduated in September 1937. In October 1937, he became chief of staff of the [[2nd Railroad Brigade NKVD]]. He became the brigade acting commander and was promoted to major on 27 September. In January 1938, he was posted to the [[Transbaikal Military District]] and became commander of the 54th [[Nerchinsko-Zavodsky District|Nerchinskozavodsk]] Border Detachment. {{Sfn|Maslov|1998|pp=13{{endash}}14}} In February 1941, Gorbachyov was awarded the [[Order of the Red Star]] on the occasion of the twentieth anniversary of the Border Troops.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://sd250.narod.ru/text/gorbachev.html|title=Горбачёв И. С. (1902-1941)|last=|first=|date=|website=sd250.narod.ru|publisher=|language=Russian|trans-title=Gorbachyov I.S. (1902-1941)|access-date=2016-08-01}}</ref>
== World War II == In early July 1941, Gorbachyov became commander of the newly formed 250th Rifle Division, which included many NKVD troops. On 15 July, he was promoted to major general. The division was assigned to the [[30th Army (Soviet Union)|30th Army]] and was deployed to the [[Western Front (Soviet Union)|Western Front]], fighting in the Battle of Smolensk. He was mortally wounded by shrapnel during a counterattack south of [[Bely, Tver Oblast|Belyi]] to relieve Soviet forces encircled at Smolensk.{{Sfn|Maslov|1998|pp=13{{endash}}14}} Gorbachyov died of his wounds on 25 July. He was buried in [[Olenino, Tver Oblast|Olenino]].<ref name=":0" />
== Personal life == Gorbachyov married and had a daughter, Galina, and two sons, Pyotr and Vladimir.<ref name=":0" />
== Notes == <references />
== References == * {{Cite book|title=Fallen Soviet Generals: Soviet General Officers Killed in Battle, 1941–1945|last=Maslov|first=Aleksander A.|publisher=Frank Cass|others=Translated by David Glantz|year=1998|isbn=9780714647906|location=London|pages=|ref=harv|via=}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gorbachyov, Ivan}} [[Category:1902 births]] [[Category:1941 deaths]] [[Category:Soviet military personnel killed in World War II]] [[Category:Soviet major generals]] [[Category:People from Smolensk Governorate]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of the Red Star]] [[Category:NKVD officers]] [[Category:Communist Party of the Soviet Union members]] [[Category:Frunze Military Academy alumni]]
